item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, January 25, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Using YOLO to Detect Office Chairs in 40M Hotel Photos (66 points | 26 comments)
2. Life lessons from the first half-century of my career (54 points | 7 comments)
3. Show HN: Cs16.css – CSS library based on Counter Strike 1.6 UI (543 points | 107 comments)
4. File Explorer is merged to Helix editor (71 points | 9 comments)
5. Show HN: Trolling SMS spammers with Ollama (153 points | 46 comments)
6. Wild – A fast linker for Linux (293 points | 131 comments)
7. Show HN: Lightpanda, an open-source headless browser in Zig (161 points | 93 comments)
8. You could have invented Fenwick trees (72 points | 16 comments)
9. A phishing attack involving g.co, Google's URL shortener (256 points | 108 comments)
10. Snowdrop OS – a homebrew operating system from scratch, in assembly language (219 points | 47 comments)
11. TinyZero (13 points | discuss)
12. Show HN: Onit – open-source ChatGPT Desktop with local mode, Claude, Gemini (96 points | 33 comments)
13. Her dad, the 10k records he left behind and a viral lesson in grief (80 points | 38 comments)
14. Caltrain's electric fleet more efficient than expected (218 points | 158 comments)
15. The hidden complexity of scaling WebSockets (101 points | 26 comments)
16. Subpixel Snake [video] (212 points | 43 comments)
17. EA Origin is shutting down (3 points | discuss)
18. New book-sorting algorithm almost reaches perfection (194 points | 41 comments)
19. Chatbox: Cross-platform desktop client for ChatGPT, Claude and other LLMs (42 points | 5 comments)
20. French police free kidnapped Ledger executive (131 points | 84 comments)
21. A very Chicago gamble (124 points | 65 comments)
22. How I Use Home Assistant in 2025 (184 points | 197 comments)
23. Anatomy of a Formal Proof (95 points | 2 comments)
24. Ask HN: Why buy domains and 301 redirect them to me? (272 points | 90 comments)
25. Deadly and Imminent; The Pentagon's Mad Dash for Silicon Valley's AI Weapons (14 points | 12 comments)
26. A WebAssembly compiler that fits in a tweet (204 points | 23 comments)
27. Trying out Zed after more than a decade of Vim/Neovim (144 points | 95 comments)
28. Android SMS Gateway Using MQTT (23 points | 3 comments)
29. Cloud Virtualization: Red Hat, AWS Firecracker, and Ubicloud internals (54 points | 9 comments)
30. Cytoskeleton-functionalized synthetic cells with life-like mechanical features (16 points | 1 comment)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, January 25, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
